alert.note: Alert for Cherokee (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 21 at 5:40AM EDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Cherokee, southwestern Rhea, northern Bradley, Sequatchie, southwestern Bledsoe, southwestern Meigs, northern Polk, McMinn, southeastern Blount, Monroe and northeastern Hamilton Counties through 645 AM EDT/545 AM CDT/... At 540 AM EDT/440 AM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles southwest of Spencer to near Athens to near Smoky Mountains-Twentymile Creek. Movement was south at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Cleveland, Athens, Dayton, Dunlap, Andrews, Pikeville, Decatur, Benton, Soddy-Daisy and Etowah. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
